active_learning.discussion_prompt: Evaluate the role of SIEM in a modern SOC, debating pros/cons of SIEM vs. emerging XDR/SOAR in the context of CIS Controls 7-16 (e.g., continuous monitoring). Address misconceptions like 'SIEM detects all threats perfectly' and discuss false positives, scalability challenges, and integration needs for effective incident response.
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, take turns explaining core SIEM concepts (e.g., event correlation vs. log management) using analogies (correlation as a detective linking clues). Partner quizzes with examples/non-examples (e.g., isolated login failure vs. correlated brute-force attack). Switch roles to cover UEBA/SOAR integration.
active_learning.problem_solving: Provide anonymized log samples (firewall denies, IDS alerts, auth failures). In groups, correlate events to detect threats (e.g., data exfiltration or brute-force). Design SIEM rules for CIS Control 13 (vulnerability management) application, then simulate tuning to reduce false positives in a SOC scenario.
